Text: Stop #2: Another great conversation today at the Little River Chamber of Commerce. One of my favorite parts about this job is having the opportunity to answer your questions and discuss real issues facing our community. https://t.co/6YBrjDiRR7

Stop #1: I was excited to join the North Myrtle Beach Chamber this morning to give a legislative update on Ukraine, inflation, infrastructure, tax reform, and many more important issues facing South Carolinians. Thank you, @DestinationNmb! https://t.co/BEqcRo3Sr3
Follow me along this week as I meet with business groups and constituents across the Seventh Congressional District!

Right now, America and the world needs strong leadership. The U.S. and its allies need to do everything in their power to stop an invasion on the innocent Ukrainian people. We must stop hiding from threats to our democracy and make Putin pay for his aggressions.

My first action as Ranking Member of the Ways and Means Oversight Subcommittee is demanding urgent action from the IRS Commissioner to address the massive backlog of unprocessed tax returns. https://t.co/QOCKmg2ego

I look forward to continuing to serve on the Select Revenue Measures and Social Security Subcommittees, using my experience as a CPA and tax lawyer to tackle issues including keeping America competitive, creating jobs, increasing opportunity, and growing our economy.

I am honored to have the opportunity to serve as the top Republican member on the House Ways and Means Oversight Subcommittee. Through this new role, I’ll work to hold the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) accountable to taxpayers across America.
Today, I’m excited to announce that I am the first South Carolinian in 36 years to earn a leadership position on the House Ways and Means Committee. https://t.co/DiptnjrRzZ

Pleased to accept the Friend of the Family Award from @FaithandFreedom this evening. This award recognizes my voting record of protecting life, strengthening families, defending religious liberty and standing with Israel. You can count on me to defend our conservative values! https://t.co/YbYcBEVkZJ
We can’t merely talk about the need for improving law enforcement relations, budgets, and trainings. This legislation delivers on those calls for thoughtful and targeted solutions.

Today, I introduced the bipartisan COPS on the Beat Grant Program Reauthorization along with 11 of my colleagues to ensure all communities are well staffed with officers who can meet the needs of the community, are trained properly, and paid a fair wage. https://t.co/HXxzYt4Gjl

I’ve met with law enforcement officers in all eight counties of the 7th District to hear how we can make our law enforcement programs work better for communities in South Carolina and across the Nation.
Police officers keep all kinds of communities safe, but those in rural and low-income communities often face barriers to doing their jobs effectively and efficiently.

Another dismal jobs report. In 4 of the past 5 months, the economy added less jobs than expected. When is President Biden going to start delivering on his promise to help our national economy recover from the pandemic? 
https://t.co/ncg5i0uQPU
Read my full statement commemorating the anniversary of the January 6th attack on the U.S. Capitol here: https://t.co/NY0OCj2lyQ

Despite the terrible events of the day and all the suffering it has caused, it shouldn’t be lost on us that our free and fair elections, our peaceful transition of power, and our Constitution survived. America is resilient.
January 6, 2021 continues to live in American history as the day we nearly lost the country our Founders fought for and left for us to preserve.

The Democratic party holds the House, Senate, and the Presidency. If they have the power to pass trillions of dollars in spending without a single Republican vote, then they can surely take responsibility for our exploding debt by raising the ceiling on their own.

great servicemembers in the U.S. National Guard. Happy 385th birthday! https://t.co/t24gX7RHaf

Currently, the HUD formulas favor large counties and discriminate against small counties, regardless of damages sustained during a major disaster.

I introduced legislation this week to revise the standards of eligibility for @HUDgov Community Development Block Grant Disaster Recovery funding for communities after major disasters. https://t.co/iigXgef9z9

I hear frequently from South Carolinians about their frustrations with FEMA and the disaster relief process. Oftentimes, it can take months to receive estimates, make repairs, and restore a home to a livable condition.

As South Carolina recuperates from disaster after disaster, FEMA’s staff turnover rates extend the process for our communities to receive the assistance we need.  FEMA must be held accountable to communities and taxpayers who rely on them following a disaster.

SC had the 4th highest increase in drug overdose deaths in 2020 - much higher than the national average. Horry County has the highest fatal drug overdoses in the state. This epidemic persists across the country, but is greatly affecting our friends, families, and neighbors.
